alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Hocking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Central Ohio, including the following counties, Fairfield, Hocking and Pickaway. * WHEN...Until 645 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 445 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Columbus, Lancaster, Pickerington, Circleville, Logan, Canal Winchester, Ashville, Baltimore, Mount Sterling, South Bloomfield, Bremen, Millersport, Williamsport, Pleasantville, New Holland, Logan Elm Village, Hide-A-Way Hills, Fairfield Beach, Commercial Point and Royalton.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
